info.title: AWS IoT Things Graph
info.description:
AWS IoT Things Graph

AWS IoT Things Graph provides an integrated set of tools that enable developers to connect devices and services that use different standards, such as units of measure and communication protocols. AWS IoT Things Graph makes it possible to build IoT applications with little to no code by connecting devices and services and defining how they interact at an abstract level.

For more information about how AWS IoT Things Graph works, see the User Guide.

The AWS IoT Things Graph service is discontinued.

servers.description: The AWS IoT Things Graph multi-region endpoint
The AWS IoT Things Graph multi-region endpoint
The AWS IoT Things Graph endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The AWS IoT Things Graph endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

post.description:
Searches for things associated with the specified entity. You can search by both device and device model.

For example, if two different devices, camera1 and camera2, implement the camera device model, the user can associate thing1 to camera1 and thing2 to camera2. SearchThings(camera2) will return only thing2, but SearchThings(camera) will return both thing1 and thing2.

This action searches for exact matches and doesn't perform partial text matching.

allOf.description: The ARN of the thing.
The name of the thing.

items.description: An AWS IoT thing.

allOf.description: An array of things in the result set.
The string to specify as nextToken when you request the next page of results.

The ID of the entity to which the things are associated.

The IDs should be in the following format.

urn:tdm:REGION/ACCOUNT ID/default:device:DEVICENAME
The string that specifies the next page of results. Use this when you're paginating results.
The maximum number of results to return in the response.
The version of the user's namespace. Defaults to the latest version of the user's namespace.

The revision number of the system.
The date when the system was created.

An object that contains summary information about a system.
The language used to define the entity. GRAPHQL is the only valid value.
The GraphQL text that defines the entity.

The definition document of a system.
The namespace version against which the system was validated. Use this value in your system instance.

An object that contains summary data about the system.

The number that specifies the revision of the system to get.

post.description: Gets revisions made to the specified system template. Only the previous 100 revisions are stored. If the system has been deprecated, this action will return the revisions that occurred before its deprecation. This action won't work with systems that have been deleted.

The revision number of the system.

urn:tdm:REGION/ACCOUNT ID/default:system:SYSTEMNAME
The string that specifies the next page of results. Use this when you're paginating results.
The maximum number of results to return in the response.

post.description: Updates the specified workflow. All deployed systems and system instances that use the workflow will see the changes in the flow when it is redeployed. If you don't want this behavior, copy the workflow (creating a new workflow with a different ID), and update the copy. The workflow can contain only entities in the specified namespace.

allOf.description: The ID of the workflow.
The ARN of the workflow.
The revision number of the workflow.
The date when the workflow was created.
An object that contains summary information about a workflow.
An object containing summary information about the updated workflow.

The ID of the workflow to be updated.

The ID should be in the following format.

urn:tdm:REGION/ACCOUNT ID/default:workflow:WORKFLOWNAME
The language used to define the entity. GRAPHQL is the only valid value.
The GraphQL text that defines the entity.
A document that defines an entity.
The DefinitionDocument that contains the updated workflow definition.

The version of the user's namespace.

If no value is specified, the latest version is used by default. Use the GetFlowTemplateRevisions if you want to find earlier revisions of the flow to update.

post.description: Searches for entities of the specified type. You can search for entities in your namespace and the public namespace that you're tracking.

allOf.description: The entity ID.
The entity ARN.
The entity type.
The time at which the entity was created.
The language used to define the entity. GRAPHQL is the only valid value.
The GraphQL text that defines the entity.
A document that defines an entity.
The definition document of the entity.

items.description: Describes the properties of an entity.

allOf.description: An array of descriptions for each entity returned in the search result.
The string to specify as nextToken when you request the next page of results.
The entity types for which to search.

The name of the entity search filter field. REFERENCED_ENTITY_ID filters on entities that are used by the entity in the result set. For example, you can filter on the ID of a property that is used in a state.
An array of string values for the search filter field. Multiple values function as AND criteria in the search.

items.description: An object that filters an entity search. Multiple filters function as OR criteria in the search. For example a search that includes a NAMESPACE and a REFERENCED_ENTITY_ID filter searches for entities in the specified namespace that use the entity specified by the value of REFERENCED_ENTITY_ID.

allOf.description:
Optional filter to apply to the search. Valid filters are NAME NAMESPACE, SEMANTIC_TYPE_PATH and REFERENCED_ENTITY_ID. REFERENCED_ENTITY_ID filters on entities that are used by the entity in the result set. For example, you can filter on the ID of a property that is used in a state.

Multiple filters function as OR criteria in the query. Multiple values passed inside the filter function as AND criteria.
The string that specifies the next page of results. Use this when you're paginating results.
The maximum number of results to return in the response.
The version of the user's namespace. Defaults to the latest version of the user's namespace.

post.description: Gets the latest version of the user's namespace and the public version that it is tracking.

allOf.description: The ARN of the namespace.
The name of the namespace.
The name of the public namespace that the latest namespace version is tracking.
The version of the public namespace that the latest version is tracking.
The version of the user's namespace to describe.
The name of the user's namespace. Set this to aws to get the public namespace.

post.description:
Asynchronously uploads one or more entity definitions to the user's namespace. The document parameter is required if syncWithPublicNamespace and deleteExistingEntites are false. If the syncWithPublicNamespace parameter is set to true, the user's namespace will synchronize with the latest version of the public namespace. If deprecateExistingEntities is set to true, all entities in the latest version will be deleted before the new DefinitionDocument is uploaded.

When a user uploads entity definitions for the first time, the service creates a new namespace for the user. The new namespace tracks the public namespace. Currently users can have only one namespace. The namespace version increments whenever a user uploads entity definitions that are backwards-incompatible and whenever a user sets the syncWithPublicNamespace parameter or the deprecateExistingEntities parameter to true.

The IDs for all of the entities should be in URN format. Each entity must be in the user's namespace. Users can't create entities in the public namespace, but entity definitions can refer to entities in the public namespace.

Valid entities are Device, DeviceModel, Service, Capability, State, Action, Event, Property, Mapping, Enum.

allOf.description: The ID that specifies the upload action. You can use this to track the status of the upload.
The language used to define the entity. GRAPHQL is the only valid value.
The GraphQL text that defines the entity.
A document that defines an entity.
The DefinitionDocument that defines the updated entities.
A Boolean that specifies whether to synchronize with the latest version of the public namespace. If set to true, the upload will create a new namespace version.
A Boolean that specifies whether to deprecate all entities in the latest version before uploading the new DefinitionDocument. If set to true, the upload will create a new namespace version.

post.description: Searches for summary information about systems in the user's account. You can filter by the ID of a workflow to return only systems that use the specified workflow.

The name of the system search filter field.
An array of string values for the search filter field. Multiple values function as AND criteria in the search.

allOf.description: An array of filters that limit the result set. The only valid filter is FLOW_TEMPLATE_ID.

This parameter to the API requires a JSON text string argument. For information on how to format a JSON parameter for the various command line tool environments, see Using JSON for Parameters in the AWS CLI User Guide.
The ID of the workflow.
The ARN of the workflow.
The revision number of the workflow.
The date when the workflow was created.
An object that contains summary information about a workflow.
An object containing summary information about the updated workflow.

The ID of the workflow to be updated.

The ID should be in the following format.

urn:tdm:REGION/ACCOUNT ID/default:workflow:WORKFLOWNAME
The language used to define the entity. GRAPHQL is the only valid value.
The GraphQL text that defines the entity.
A document that defines an entity.
The DefinitionDocument that contains the updated workflow definition.

The version of the user's namespace.

If no value is specified, the latest version is used by default. Use the GetFlowTemplateRevisions if you want to find earlier revisions of the flow to update.
The ID of the system.
The ARN of the system.
The revision number of the system.
The date when the system was created.
An object that contains information about a system.
An object containing summary information about the updated system.

The ID of the system to be updated.

The ID should be in the following format.

urn:tdm:REGION/ACCOUNT ID/default:system:SYSTEMNAME
The language used to define the entity. GRAPHQL is the only valid value.
The GraphQL text that defines the entity.
A document that defines an entity.
The DefinitionDocument that contains the updated system definition.

The version of the user's namespace. Defaults to the latest version of the user's namespace.

If no value is specified, the latest version is used by default.
The ID that specifies the upload action. You can use this to track the status of the upload.
The language used to define the entity. GRAPHQL is the only valid value.
The GraphQL text that defines the entity.
A document that defines an entity.
The DefinitionDocument that defines the updated entities.
A Boolean that specifies whether to synchronize with the latest version of the public namespace. If set to true, the upload will create a new namespace version.
A Boolean that specifies whether to deprecate all entities in the latest version before uploading the new DefinitionDocument. If set to true, the upload will create a new namespace version.
The language used to define the entity. GRAPHQL is the only valid value.
The GraphQL text that defines the entity.

allOf.description: The name of the entity search filter field. REFERENCED_ENTITY_ID filters on entities that are used by the entity in the result set. For example, you can filter on the ID of a property that is used in a state.
An array of string values for the search filter field. Multiple values function as AND criteria in the search.

EntityFilter.description: An object that filters an entity search. Multiple filters function as OR criteria in the search. For example a search that includes a NAMESPACE and a REFERENCED_ENTITY_ID filter searches for entities in the specified namespace that use the entity specified by the value of REFERENCED_ENTITY_ID.
